required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prague Registry of Electric Cardioversion for Supraventricular Arrhythmias

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute for Clinical and Experimental Medicine

clinical_study.source: Institute for Clinical and Experimental Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This single-center observational registry follows contemporary efficacy and short-term complications of elective electric cardioversion.

primary_outcome.description: Major thromboembolic events or events related to cardioversion requiring unplanned hospitalisation (bleeding, severe bradycardia, anesthesia-related complications, heart failure etc)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours to 30 days after the procedure
primary_outcome.description: Major thromboembolic events or events related to cardioversion requiring unplanned hospitalisation (bleeding, severe bradycardia, anesthesia-related complications, acute heart failure etc), evaluated by structured phone call.

secondary_outcome.description: Minor procedure-related complications not requiring acute hospitalisation (asymptomatic bradycardia, post-anesthesia spasms)
Presence of sinus rhythm on continous ECG (5-lead) monitoring

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent elective cardioversion for atrial arrhythmia

intervention.description: Electric cardioversion in short sedation according to established clinical practice and indications

study_pop.textblock: Hemodynamically stable patients scheduled for ambulatory electric cardioversion for atrial arrhythmias based on established clinical indications.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Consecutive out-patients undergoing electric cardioversion for atrial fibrillation, atrial tachycardia, or typical atrial flutter
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable patients with acute conditions requiring unplanned hospitalization

facility.name: Institute for Clinical and Experimental Medicine (IKEM)

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Institute for Clinical and Experimental Medicine
responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of the Department of Acute Cardiology
